meanings.definition: The action of crossing or intersecting, especially in the form of an X.
meanings.sent1: The decussation of the two roads created a unique pattern on the map.
meanings.sent2: The decussation of the train tracks made it challenging to navigate the area.
meanings.sent3: The decussation of the spaghetti strands in the pot looked like a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The decussation of opinions in the meeting led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The decussation of the tree branches against the sky was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A point at which two lines, pathways, or structures cross or intersect.
meanings.sent1: At the decussation of the hiking trails, we decided to take a break.
meanings.sent2: The decussation of nerves in the body is crucial for proper functioning.
meanings.sent3: The decussation of the shopping carts in the store aisle caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The decussation of cultures in the city center created a vibrant atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The decussation of the power lines against the sunset painted a striking image.
